author: cbs8
title: Auditor: Madison Co. improperly collects fire district tax
text:
MADISON, Miss. (AP) - The Mississippi auditor says Madison County has been improperly collecting tax for several years to provide fire protection in part of the county.
Auditor Stacey Pickering on Friday told The Clarion-Ledger ( http://on.thec-l.com/1W9QQLq ) his staff found the error during a routine examination of spending.
A tax has been collected since 2008, when the county built a new fire station to protect about 30,000 residents in an area previously covered by a volunteer fire department.
When the new station was built, the county increased property tax to cover the cost. State law allows such a tax to be set, but a referendum is required unless the fire district existed before 1987.
Madison County Administrator Mark Houston says officials thought no referendum was needed. A vote is now planned for next spring.
Information from: The Clarion-Ledger, http://www.clarionledger.com
